text: so I went off in my lunch break
typically I like to go off to either a
mosque or to a prayer room to do my
midday trays in my lunch break at work
but for the last week or so because
we're we're gone had been closed for a
two-week holiday I was going down to the
local park in woollen long to pray my
midday prayer what ended up happening
was about midway through my first prayer
I heard a yelling and screaming and
because I was concentrated on my prayer
and you know this is the specific time
between me and God I kind of ignore that
and just focused on what I was doing but
as of screaming and as the yelling
became louder and louder I started to
recognize what this woman was saying
what she was saying you know and I won't
put it as graphically as you know she
kind of put it was she was telling me
that I was an effing terrorist to go
back in and fight for Isis in Syria to
stop praying to that piece of s upstairs
I'm calling me an effing Ali Baba saying
that I was a dirty Muslim Pig and it
just kept going on and on now I ignore
this through my prayer after I finished
praying maybe some 10 minutes later I
called the police while I was still in a
kneeling position I let them know what
was happening and then after I got off
the phone with the police I approached
her and I said maybe five or 10 meters
away from her I said to her I said ma'am
what is it about me or what I'm doing
that you find so offensive and that's
when she got even louder and she got
more abusive and more threatening to me
and she was pointing to a woman who was
down there down the park area maybe
about 30 40 meters away who was playing
with several of her young children and
saying that I'm gonna go rip the scarfs
off all the women around
here and that they're effing beings and
all that kind of stuff and I said to her
look I'm sorry that you found what I was
doing or Who I am or how I look what my
religion is so offensive but I've got a
right to be in this park and you know
I'm just you know I'm serving my own
values and my own life in a peaceful
manner and that's when she said we'll
use what no right to do anything like
that this is our Park this is our land
this is Australia you're not Australian
you should go off and you know it was
just a tirade of abuse and threats and
threats against my life and against the
lives of Muslims at this point several
other people at the park came up to me
and said you know you okay one of them
has said that they'd already called the
police as well they said to me you know
this obviously is an indicative of what
all Australians believe and I said to
the mirror of course you know I've been
in this country for over 20 years I've
met the majority of Australians who were
great you know accepting and really
tolerant of different views and opinions
but obviously you know unfortunately
it's the minority amongst any community
that make the loudest noise and I
started really reflecting upon maybe the
experiences of other young Muslims and
Muslims in general in Australia and
maybe even minorities in Australia and I
could really feel why they feel isolated
and why maybe some of them feel as if
they have to go to you know alternative
groups or maybe alternative ideologies
to feel accepted I can see the logic or
see why some people might join a group a
terror group or a gang group or any kind
of group
